question.wording: 1- The object needed to create a connection through AJAX is:
2- To indicate that an AJAX connection is synchronous or asynchronous:

choices.choice: We include a third parameter in the call to the connection's open() method
Add a third parameter to the createConnection() method of the AJAX connection
We add a third parameter to the send() method of the AJAX connection
We use the sendSynchronous or sendAsyncrhonous methods of the object that stores the connection

question.wording: 3- AJAX means:
4- The type property of the object with which an AJAX call is made through jQuery:

choices.choice: Allows you to indicate whether the connection is synchronous or asynchronous
Allows us to indicate the format of the data we want to obtain from the server
Allows you to indicate whether or not data is sent to the server
Allows you to indicate whether to make a connection using the GET method or the POST method

question.wording: 5- The use of some framework (work environment or library) Javascript:

choices.choice: Not a highly recommended option, especially since it causes us a lot of cross-browser compatibility issues
Does not affect the usability of our site in terms of cross-browser compatibility
This is a highly recommended option, especially since it solves many cross-browser compatibility issues for us
Should be avoided if we want to create websites compatible with most browsers

question.wording: 6- If we use non-intrusive Javascript techniques:

choices.choice: We will not be able to include any css tag in our code
We will include our Javascript code in external files in which the event assignment will even be
We will include the Javascript code inside the CSS files to make the minimum number of inclusions in the HTML file
We will not be able to include any script tag in our code

question.wording: 7- The correct way to store information in JSON format in a Javascript variable is:
8- All browsers use the XMLHttpRequest object to create AJAX connections

choices.choice: True, because XMLHttpRequest is an object to create AJAX connections
False, because XMLHttpRequest is not an object to create AJAX connections

question.wording: 9- By default, browsers do not allow connections to be made via AJAX to servers other than the one that sent us the web page. This is due to:

choices.choice: For security reasons: to avoid using Javascript to control pages located on other servers
For technical reasons: a browser would not know to connect to a different server
For security reasons: to avoid AJAX controlling pages located on other servers
For usability reasons: the user would have to type many URLs for the browser to load them

AJAX is a computer programming system.
